intro: Adenolobus pechuelii subsp. mossamedensis, commonly known as the Mossamedes adenolobus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense heads, which bloom during the warmer months. It is adapted to survive in dry conditions, with succulent leaves that store water. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and ecological adaptations.
